sentence.Network_en: The price of property in the city is prohibitive.
sentence.Network_cn: 城市的房地产价格令人望而却步。

sentence.Network_en: The cost of repairs would be prohibitive.
sentence.Network_cn: 修理费会高得令人望而却步.
费用高得使人不敢问津.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in sense 2): from French prohibitif, -ive or Latin prohibitivus, from prohibit- 'kept in check', from the verb prohibere (see prohibit)

entry.tran: （费用）高得令很多人负担不起的，贵得让人望而却步的
entry.def: If the cost of something is prohibitive, it is so high that many people cannot afford it.

example.ex: The cost of private treatment can be prohibitive.
example.tran: 自费治疗的费用高得让人望而却步。

example.ex: ...the prohibitive prices charged for seats at the opera.

stems_affixes.word_buile: prohibit[v.禁止,不准;阻止]+ive……的→adj.抑制的,价格昂贵的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 放荡不羁的, 不受抑制的
stems_affixes.word_buile: un不+inhibit[v.抑制,约束]+ed……的→adj.放荡不羁的, 不受抑制的
exhibit[v.展出,陈列 n.展览品,陈列品]+ion表名词→n.展览会;陈列,展览
exhibition[n.展览会;陈列,展览]+ist人→n.喜欢出风头的人

stems_affixes.value_cn: 抑制;阻止,禁止;[心]感情阻力
stems_affixes.word_buile: inhibit[v.抑制,约束]+ion表名词→n.抑制;阻止,禁止;[心]感情阻力
prohibit[v.禁止,不准;阻止]+ion表名词→n.禁止;禁令,禁律
pro前面+hibit拿住→在前面拿住→不让前进→禁止
